leads.lead_text: Nut distinctly trigonous or triquetrous, dull, conspicuously wrinkled or warty on the flattish faces; anthers 0.7–1.5 mm long; leaves subtending flower clusters often 3 cm long or more; elevated, dry rocky areas in east

Nut rather obscurely trigonous, shining, each face with a broad longitudinal groove, otherwise smooth or slightly transversely wrinkled; anthers 0.6–1 mm long; leaves subtending flower clusters usually 1–2 cm long; north-western mallee areas
